news.title: Come vendere criptovalute in cambio di contanti con MetaMask
news.subtitle: La funzione di vendita del portafoglio di MetaMask ti consente di vendere criptovalute in contanti tramite fornitori verificati, in pochi clic.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
La funzione di vendita di MetaMask Portfolio ti consente di incassare facilmente le criptovalute in valuta legale (USD, EUR, GBP). In combinazione con la funzione Acquista, ti consente di avere un'esperienza web3 in autonomia con meno intermediari e una conversione in valuta legale pi√π rapida direttamente alla destinazione prescelta, ove disponibile, come il tuo conto bancario o saldo PayPal.


Fornitori di criptovalute verificati


Piuttosto che limitarsi a un singolo fornitore, MetaMask aggrega una serie di fornitori verificati (molti dei quali sono nella sezione flusso di Acquista) ‚Äî assicurando che soddisfino i propri elevati standard ‚Äî cos√¨ da presentarti diverse opzioni in tempo reale per convertire i tuoi ETH su Ethereum Mainnet nella valuta legale di tua scelta (ove disponibile).

Un pubblico globale


La funzione di vendita √® attualmente disponibile negli Stati Uniti (si applicano restrizioni statali), nel Regno Unito e in alcune parti d'Europa con piani di espansione in altre regioni per soddisfare la nostra comunit√† mondiale. Garantire agli utenti un modo per entrare e uscire liberamente dalle criptovalute √® importante e speriamo che queste opzioni lo rendano web3 possibile per pi√π persone. Inizialmente supportiamo ETH su Ethereum Mainnet, con l'intenzione di espanderci presto ai token gas nativi sulle reti di livello 2 e alle valute legali USD, EUR e GBP.

Come utilizzare la funzione Vendi criptovalute su MetaMask Portfolio:


Per vendere le tue criptovalute in cambio di contanti:

  1. Collega il tuo wallet MetaMask a portfolio.metamask.io
  2. Clicca sulla scheda ‚ÄúVendi‚Äù per iniziare
  3. Seleziona la tua regione
  4. Seleziona il token cripto e la rete da cui vuoi vendere (ad esempio: ETH su Ethereum)
  5. Seleziona la destinazione del conto in valuta legale disponibile nella tua ubicazione (ad esempio: conto bancario o saldo PayPal)
  6. Inserisci l'importo in criptovalute che desideri vendere (ad esempio: 0,5 ETH)
  7. Tutte le quotazioni dei diversi fornitori disponibili verranno presentate in tempo reale. Selezionane una per continuare.
  8. Verrai reindirizzato in modo sicuro al sito Web del fornitore per registrarti e collegare il tuo conto in valuta legale, e poi verrai indirizzato di nuovo su MetaMask Portfolio.
  9. Seleziona "Invia ETH a [fornitore]" per inviare criptovalute dal tuo wallet al tuo conto in valuta legale.
  10. Conferma la transazione nel tuo portafoglio MetaMask.
  11. Potrai tenere traccia del tuo ordine mentre viene elaborato nella scheda "Vendi". Le tempistiche variano a seconda del fornitore e potrebbero essere necessari alcuni giorni prima di visualizzare i fondi nel tuo conto in valuta legale.

Operazione riuscita! ü¶ä

Ottimizzato con i fornitori


L'utilizzo delle funzioni Acquista e Vendi su MetaMask Portfolio ti consente di "chiudere il cerchio" nel tuo viaggio nelle criptovalute e valute legali, con molti degli stessi fornitori. Ci√≤ significa che dovrai registrarti e collegare il tuo conto bancario solo una volta con un fornitore specifico. Ci auguriamo che queste funzionalit√† ti piacciano.

Sei pronto a provarlo? Scopri di pi√π su metamask.io/portfolio/.

MetaMask Portfolio: traccia e gestisci tutto del tuo web3

MetaMask Portfolio fornisce una piattaforma completa e intuitiva per soddisfare le tue esigenze del web3 e darti il controllo. Grazie a Dashboard, Acquista, Swap, Bridge e Stake, non hai nulla di cui preoccuparti. Lavoriamo incessantemente per migliorare e sviluppare la DApp con aggiornamenti significativi. Clicca qui per saperne di pi√π su MetaMask Portfolio e le sue funzionalit√†.

nodes.title: MetaMask feature update: Gas Station
nodes.subtitle: Make running out of gas a thing of the past.

image.title: MetaMask feature update: Gas Station
image.description: MetaMask feature update: Gas Station image

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Being blocked by insufficient gas will no longer be a problem when swapping, thanks to MetaMask‚Äôs new Gas Station feature. Gas Station, aka gas-included swaps, is now available when you enable Smart Transactions with MetaMask Swaps.

Most web3 users have experienced running out of gas. If users do not have enough ETH balance to cover network fees, they cannot proceed with their transaction. When this happens, users must go through a time consuming, and often costly, on-ramping process, such as purchasing ETH on a centralized exchange, and transferring funds to their on-chain wallet. On-chain opportunities can be time-sensitive, and the on-ramping process can take hours.

With the rollout of Gas Station, our gas-included Swaps feature, users will be able to seamlessly and speedily complete their transactions ‚Äî with network fees included in the quote(s) they receive. Additionally, users will not be limited to any specific liquidity source for their Swaps, meaning we will still compare prices across the same wide variety of providers as we do today. Our Swaps feature combines data from decentralized exchange aggregators, market makers, and DEXs, to ensure you get competitive quotes with the lowest network fees.

Gas Station is live on MetaMask Extension via Ethereum mainnet, with mobile release on the horizon. Swaps value must be sufficient to also cover the cost of gas, and include the following assets: USDT, USDC, DAI, ETH, wETH, wBTC, wstETH, wSOL.

Head to MetaMask Portfolio today to get swapping. Looking for more? Dive into our recent updates here.

nodes.metaDescription: MetaMask's new Gas Station feature ‚Äî aka gas-included swaps ‚Äî now includes network fees in the quotes users receive.

nodes.title: MetaMask feature update: Chain Permissions
nodes.subtitle: Use dapps on any network with granular control.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask‚Äôs latest Extension updates optimize your experience when interacting with dapps and networks ‚Äì¬†via seamless 'intra-dapp' network switching, granular permission controls, and RPC url management.

As web3 evolves, users increasingly interact with multiple dapps across various networks. Earlier this year, MetaMask elevated the multichain experience by remembering the network used for each dapp, eliminating the need for manual network switching when using multiple dapps simultaneously. Our new update takes it a step further. Users can now sign transactions on any permitted network, without needing to approve the network switch.

Permissions are granted to each dapp at the time of connection, and can always be managed by the user to maintain flexibility and control. When users connect a dapp, the account that they are on, and all default enabled networks, will be permissioned for that dapp. You can edit at the time of connection, or after the connection has been made in the All Permissions section. Home stakers, and others preferring their own infrastructure, can also review and update their chosen RPC url as needed.

Having control over the networks that dapps have access to adds a security layer‚Äîminimizing the impact of interacting with potentially malicious dapps to permitted networks. As the multichain ecosystem continues to expand, MetaMask is here to meet your needs and keep you protected along the way.

Make sure you're using the latest version of MetaMask Extension for optimal security, and visit our support page to learn how to stay up to date. Looking for more? Dive into all our recent updates here.

nodes.metaDescription: MetaMask's new Chain Permissions update lets you seamlessly use dapps on any network, with granular control and trusted security.

nodes.title: Introducing MetaMask Signature Insights Snaps
nodes.subtitle: A new way to stay protected with community-powered tools.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Safety is paramount in today's digital world ‚Äî especially in web3, where users frequently interact with decentralized applications and manage valuable assets. A common vulnerability in the ecosystem is malicious signature requests, which lead unsuspecting users to authorize transactions that compromise their assets. This can happen by tricking people into signing something that allows a nefarious actor to transfer a users‚Äô assets.

To address this critical safety issue, MetaMask has introduced Signature Insight Snaps, a new category of security tools built by third-party developers. These Snaps empower users with greater transparency and control over signature requests, helping to identify and avoid potential threats.

Signature Insight Snaps integrate seamlessly with MetaMask. These tools work by analyzing the contents of requests, giving users insights into the signature‚Äôs purpose and potential risks. Leveraging knowledge from Signature Insight Snaps allows users to make more informed decisions, reducing the likelihood of falling victim to phishing attempts, unauthorized access, or other malicious activities. The added layer of security reinforces users' trust, and also fosters a safer environment for web3 interactions.

Discover our first Signature Insights Snaps

Kleros Scout is the first Snap to support Signature Insights. It decodes the content of signature requests, and identifies the addresses of any contracts you may be authorizing in the signature via Kleros‚Äôs decentralized token curated registries. It can then warn you if the contract you are interacting with is malicious.

Above, the Kleros Scout insight is displayed in the new signature request design. The insight shows that the contract being authorized by this signature request is the official Seaport 1.6 contract for NFT trading deployed by OpenSea.

ZyFi Paymaster Insights is our second Signature Insight Snap to launch. It improves the readability of signing transactions in the zkSync ecosystem, especially for paymaster-related transactions using txType 113. ZyFi Paymaster Insights adds helpful information about the ‚Äúfrom‚Äù and ‚Äúto‚Äù addresses for these paymaster-related transactions. Additionally, it provides extra information related to the paymaster, such as the address, type, gas fee token address, and gas fee token amount. This gives users more clarity on what they‚Äôre signing, helping them to avoid potentially malicious signatures.

Above, the ZyFi Paymaster Insight shows the from address, to address, and the paymaster type of the signature request on zkSync.

Install Kleros Scout Snap and ZyFi Paymaster Insights from the MetaMask Snaps Directory in MetaMask Extension 12.4.2 or later.

Build your own

Visit the MetaMask Developer Documentation to learn how you can build your own Signature Insight Snaps, and sign-up for our Builder Engagement Program so we can support you on your developer journey.

In the future, Signature Insights Snaps will be able to hook into alerts in signature requests. MetaMask will also offer more types of insights including information about origin URL of any request.

Head to the MetaMask Snaps Directory to discover security Snaps that will keep you safe in your web3 journey.

nodes.metaDescription: Explore MetaMask Signature Insights Snaps, which help to safeguard web3 users from malicious signature requests.
